{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Electrical Engineer (Instrumentation & Control)",
  "description": "Codelabprojects Nigeria Limited is a tech Company offering a range of digital solutions and services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. Our services include Web and Mobile Application Development, Business and IT Solutions, Digital Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, Website/E-commerce, Branding and Print solutions, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer (Instrumentation &amp; Control)
Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja, Ibeju-Lekki - Lagos, and Delta
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Job Description


	We are seeking a talented and experienced Electrical Engineer with a strong background in AI and technical expertise in the oil and gas sector (upstream) and a range of related fields.
	The ideal candidate will have a passion for innovation and be able to contribute to cutting-edge projects that leverage machine learning, pattern recognition, and advanced electrical engineering practices and work in our Research and Development Unit to assist in designing and testing out various systems/tools for our organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and test electrical systems and components, ensuring their functionality and performance meet project requirements.
	Integrate AI techniques such as machine learning and pattern recognition into electrical engineering projects to enhance product capabilities.
	Develop, prototype, and program electronic circuits using Arduino and other microcontroller platforms.
	Create and design printed circuit boards (PCBs) with industry-standard tools for a variety of applications.
	Utilize AutoCAD for electrical schematics and detailed system designs to support project development.
	Analyze and visualize data using Power BI to support project insights and decision-making processes.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders, to ensure seamless integration of electrical components into broader systems.
	Stay updated with the latest advancements in electrical engineering, machine learning, and related technologies.


Required Skills and Qualifications


	2.1 or 1st Class only&nbsp;with a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field (Master&rsquo;s preferred).
	Proven experience with AI applications, including machine learning and pattern recognition.
	Strong knowledge of Arduino programming and experience in designing and prototyping electronic circuits.
	Proficiency in PCB design, with the ability to create and optimize PCB layouts.
	Experience with AutoCAD for electrical system design and schematics.
	Strong data analysis skills with experience using Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
	Problem-solving mindset with a keen interest in innovative technologies.
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Preferred Skills:


	Familiarity with other microcontroller platforms and hardware development tools.
	Experience with simulation tools such as MATLAB and Simulink.
	Knowledge of IoT systems and their integration with electrical components.
	Understanding of electrical safety standards and industry regulations.
	Hands-on experience building components, Arduino experience, etc.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (N250,000 / month) and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	Collaborative work environment with access to cutting-edge technology.
	A chance to work on innovative projects that push the boundaries of technology.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@codelabprojects.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note
Kindly answer the following Questions:


	Where do you reside?
	Are you done with your NYSC?
	Can you resume immediately?
	Are you comfortable with the advertised salary?
	Mention the software you are comfortable using on a professional level.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-18",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "CodeLabProjects Group(CLP)"

Electrical Engineer (Instrumentation & Control) Job at CodeLabProjects Group(CLP)




        
    

        
        Codelabprojects Nigeria Limited is a tech Company offering a range of digital solutions and services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. Our services include Web and Mobile Application Development, Business and IT Solutions, Digital Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, Website/E-commerce, Branding and Print solutions, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer (Instrumentation & Control)
Job Locations: Abuja, Ibeju-Lekki - Lagos, and Delta
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a talented and experienced Electrical Engineer with a strong background in AI and technical expertise in the oil and gas sector (upstream) and a range of related fields.
	The ideal candidate will have a passion for innovation and be able to contribute to cutting-edge projects that leverage machine learning, pattern recognition, and advanced electrical engineering practices and work in our Research and Development Unit to assist in designing and testing out various systems/tools for our organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, and test electrical systems and components, ensuring their functionality and performance meet project requirements.
	Integrate AI techniques such as machine learning and pattern recognition into electrical engineering projects to enhance product capabilities.
	Develop, prototype, and program electronic circuits using Arduino and other microcontroller platforms.
	Create and design printed circuit boards (PCBs) with industry-standard tools for a variety of applications.
	Utilize AutoCAD for electrical schematics and detailed system designs to support project development.
	Analyze and visualize data using Power BI to support project insights and decision-making processes.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders, to ensure seamless integration of electrical components into broader systems.
	Stay updated with the latest advancements in electrical engineering, machine learning, and related technologies.


Required Skills and Qualifications


	2.1 or 1st Class only with a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field (Master’s preferred).
	Proven experience with AI applications, including machine learning and pattern recognition.
	Strong knowledge of Arduino programming and experience in designing and prototyping electronic circuits.
	Proficiency in PCB design, with the ability to create and optimize PCB layouts.
	Experience with AutoCAD for electrical system design and schematics.
	Strong data analysis skills with experience using Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
	Problem-solving mindset with a keen interest in innovative technologies.
	Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Preferred Skills:


	Familiarity with other microcontroller platforms and hardware development tools.
	Experience with simulation tools such as MATLAB and Simulink.
	Knowledge of IoT systems and their integration with electrical components.
	Understanding of electrical safety standards and industry regulations.
	Hands-on experience building components, Arduino experience, etc.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (N250,000 / month) and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	Collaborative work environment with access to cutting-edge technology.
	A chance to work on innovative projects that push the boundaries of technology.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@codelabprojects.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note
Kindly answer the following Questions:


	Where do you reside?
	Are you done with your NYSC?
	Can you resume immediately?
	Are you comfortable with the advertised salary?
	Mention the software you are comfortable using on a professional level.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Manager",
  "description": "WorleyParsons has had a presence in Africa since the 1970&#39;s when Parsons E&amp;C established their offices in Cairo, Egypt. Since that time the company has continued to spread across the continent and in 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Over the past five years, WorleyParsons has executed more than 100 projects in over 15 countries. In 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Worley Parsons has the skills and technologies to address all challenges, from small brownfield services contracts to mega greenfield projects. Our service capability covers the entire asset lifecycle: from identifying the opportunity to the operating phase.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager

Requisition ID: LAG007B
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria
Job Field (Function / Discipline):&nbsp;Project Management

Responsibilities
Primary objectives:


	To plan, co-ordinate and manage the design, procurement, construction and commissioning of assigned projects, including taking a leadership role in the preparation of proposals.
	To ensure clear agreement of client objectives and that these are met or exceeded.
	To achieve or better the budgeted gross margin.
	To provide strong HSE leadership


Team Management:


	Provide clear and focused leadership for the project team to create a vision for project success and a strategy to fit that vision.
	Define roles and responsibilities
	Focus team on achievement of milestones and other key project objectives.
	Listen to the team, discuss the issues, resolve problems and direct activities to remove roadblocks and achieve objectives.
	Provide mentoring and participate in staff performance evaluations.
	Identify and implement training requirements


Client Relationships:


	Identify, document and communicate the client requirements
	Effective management of multiple stakeholders
	Maintain and build healthy client relationships throughout the project and post completion.
	Proactively resolve performance, scope, cost and schedule issues with the Client as they arise.


Cost Control:


	Plan and prepare accurate project estimates and maintain overall CP budgets.
	Establish cost report for control of projects.
	Monitoring and control of all cost aspects of the project to forecast costs, obtain approvals, identify trends and take action to avoid cost overruns and take advantage of opportunities
	Assess performance of cost control system &amp; personnel.


Design Management:


	Set clear objectives for the design team.
	Ensures design team aware of, and complying with, client&#39;s Basis of Design and applicable regulations and codes.
	Monitor design activities, inter-discipline data flow and communications.


Procurement/Subcontracts Management:


	Set clear objectives for the procurement and subcontracts team.
	Assess procurement process throughout the project to ensure goods meet specification, are delivered on time and are within budget.


Construction Management:


	Set clear objectives for the Construction team.
	Interface with Construction manager on day-day activities
	Monitor the Construction Management function to ensure safe delivery of the project within cost and schedule objectives.


Requirements
Education &ndash; Qualifications, Accreditation, Training:


	Mechanical, Chemical, or Civil&nbsp; Engineering Degree (Bachelor Level, Graduate Level Desired)


Job Specific Knowledge:&nbsp;


	Demonstrable commitment to HSE Management in a project environment
	Excellent leadership and communication skills
	High level of customer focus
	Proven ability in leading multidiscipline activities.
	Previous experience as a project manager on projects of up to US$100m+ total value


Industry Specific Experience:


	Broad knowledge of oil &amp; gas practices, processes, and engineering toolkits
	15 or more years of Facilities Engineering experience
	Functions as a technical specialist who has the capability to make decisions and recommendations that are authoritative and can have a far reaching impact on the overall engineering for the project
	Experience on Project Management Teams (PMT) reviewing and approving EPC contractor deliverables and providing specification clarifications
	Good organizational and strong technical judgement skills
	Strong leadership and coordination capability
	Demonstrated teamwork skills and experience working independently
	Demonstrated skills to influence Contractors positively
	Ability to be effective with minimal supervision
	Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, extremely heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities
	Ability to summarize very complex content/ideas to its core essence and then&nbsp; articulate via written&nbsp;
	Clear, concise, and persuasive communication for a variety of settings


HSE Capability:


	Safety &ndash; Responsible for personal safety and his/her staffs safe working practices for DA. Understand and follow HSE procedures.


IT Skills:&nbsp;


	Proficient in MS Office suite of software programs, Lotus Notes, Outlook, etc.


People Skills:


	Effective communications with the project team.
	Documented communication requirements.
	Accurate, timely &amp; effective progress reporting to the Client and internally to WorleyParsons management.
	Ongoing monitoring of the communication network between project staff, the client and third parties and introduction of changes where required.
	&nbsp;High levels of enthusiasm, ability to self manage, strong analytical skills. Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications


Other Requirements:


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 15 or more years of Facilities Engineering experience
	Mechanical, Chemical, or Civil Engineering Degree (Bachelor Level, Graduate Level Desired)
	Previous experience as a project manager on projects of up to US$100m+ total value
	Experience on Project Management Teams (PMT) reviewing and approving EPC contractor deliverables and providing specification clarifications
	Whatever your ambition, there&#39;s a path for you here.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-18",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-19",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "WorleyParsons"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

  },

Project Manager Job at WorleyParsons




        
    

        
        WorleyParsons has had a presence in Africa since the 1970's when Parsons E&C established their offices in Cairo, Egypt. Since that time the company has continued to spread across the continent and in 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Over the past five years, WorleyParsons has executed more than 100 projects in over 15 countries. In 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Worley Parsons has the skills and technologies to address all challenges, from small brownfield services contracts to mega greenfield projects. Our service capability covers the entire asset lifecycle: from identifying the opportunity to the operating phase.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager

Requisition ID: LAG007B
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job Field (Function / Discipline): Project Management

Responsibilities
Primary objectives:


	To plan, co-ordinate and manage the design, procurement, construction and commissioning of assigned projects, including taking a leadership role in the preparation of proposals.
	To ensure clear agreement of client objectives and that these are met or exceeded.
	To achieve or better the budgeted gross margin.
	To provide strong HSE leadership


Team Management:


	Provide clear and focused leadership for the project team to create a vision for project success and a strategy to fit that vision.
	Define roles and responsibilities
	Focus team on achievement of milestones and other key project objectives.
	Listen to the team, discuss the issues, resolve problems and direct activities to remove roadblocks and achieve objectives.
	Provide mentoring and participate in staff performance evaluations.
	Identify and implement training requirements


Client Relationships:


	Identify, document and communicate the client requirements
	Effective management of multiple stakeholders
	Maintain and build healthy client relationships throughout the project and post completion.
	Proactively resolve performance, scope, cost and schedule issues with the Client as they arise.


Cost Control:


	Plan and prepare accurate project estimates and maintain overall CP budgets.
	Establish cost report for control of projects.
	Monitoring and control of all cost aspects of the project to forecast costs, obtain approvals, identify trends and take action to avoid cost overruns and take advantage of opportunities
	Assess performance of cost control system & personnel.


Design Management:


	Set clear objectives for the design team.
	Ensures design team aware of, and complying with, client's Basis of Design and applicable regulations and codes.
	Monitor design activities, inter-discipline data flow and communications.


Procurement/Subcontracts Management:


	Set clear objectives for the procurement and subcontracts team.
	Assess procurement process throughout the project to ensure goods meet specification, are delivered on time and are within budget.


Construction Management:


	Set clear objectives for the Construction team.
	Interface with Construction manager on day-day activities
	Monitor the Construction Management function to ensure safe delivery of the project within cost and schedule objectives.


Requirements
Education – Qualifications, Accreditation, Training:


	Mechanical, Chemical, or Civil  Engineering Degree (Bachelor Level, Graduate Level Desired)


Job Specific Knowledge: 


	Demonstrable commitment to HSE Management in a project environment
	Excellent leadership and communication skills
	High level of customer focus
	Proven ability in leading multidiscipline activities.
	Previous experience as a project manager on projects of up to US$100m+ total value


Industry Specific Experience:


	Broad knowledge of oil & gas practices, processes, and engineering toolkits
	15 or more years of Facilities Engineering experience
	Functions as a technical specialist who has the capability to make decisions and recommendations that are authoritative and can have a far reaching impact on the overall engineering for the project
	Experience on Project Management Teams (PMT) reviewing and approving EPC contractor deliverables and providing specification clarifications
	Good organizational and strong technical judgement skills
	Strong leadership and coordination capability
	Demonstrated teamwork skills and experience working independently
	Demonstrated skills to influence Contractors positively
	Ability to be effective with minimal supervision
	Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, extremely heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities
	Ability to summarize very complex content/ideas to its core essence and then  articulate via written 
	Clear, concise, and persuasive communication for a variety of settings


HSE Capability:


	Safety – Responsible for personal safety and his/her staffs safe working practices for DA. Understand and follow HSE procedures.


IT Skills: 


	Proficient in MS Office suite of software programs, Lotus Notes, Outlook, etc.


People Skills:


	Effective communications with the project team.
	Documented communication requirements.
	Accurate, timely & effective progress reporting to the Client and internally to WorleyParsons management.
	Ongoing monitoring of the communication network between project staff, the client and third parties and introduction of changes where required.
	 High levels of enthusiasm, ability to self manage, strong analytical skills. Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications


Other Requirements:


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 15 or more years of Facilities Engineering experience
	Mechanical, Chemical, or Civil Engineering Degree (Bachelor Level, Graduate Level Desired)
	Previous experience as a project manager on projects of up to US$100m+ total value
	Experience on Project Management Teams (PMT) reviewing and approving EPC contractor deliverables and providing specification clarifications
	Whatever your ambition, there's a path for you here.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Mechanical Engineer",
  "description": "WorleyParsons has had a presence in Africa since the 1970&#39;s when Parsons E&amp;C established their offices in Cairo, Egypt. Since that time the company has continued to spread across the continent and in 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Over the past five years, WorleyParsons has executed more than 100 projects in over 15 countries. In 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Worley Parsons has the skills and technologies to address all challenges, from small brownfield services contracts to mega greenfield projects. Our service capability covers the entire asset lifecycle: from identifying the opportunity to the operating phase.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Mechanical Engineer

Requisition ID: LAG007E
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria
Job Field (Function / Discipline):&nbsp;Mechanical

Primary Objective


	Carry out development and detailed design engineering activities, including co-ordination with the various discipline groups, to engineer the next phase of minimal facility platforms (MFP&rsquo;s) in the Gulf of Thailand.


Specific Accountabilities


	Perform engineering design duties associated with the development of the next phase of MFP&rsquo;s, being designed by Worley.
	Duties will include equipment selection and specification, detail design in collaboration with designers and bid evaluation/ vendor document review and approval.
	Quality Assurance &ndash; Responsible for working within the provisions and guidelines of the Quality Assurance system relevant to the Oil &amp; Gas Business Unit
	Safety &ndash; Responsible for personal safety safe working practices for the Oil &amp; Gas Business Unit. Understand and follow OH&amp;S procedures.


Requirements


	+10 Years of Mechanical design experience in the Oil &amp; Gas environment, including a minimum of 2 years experience in offshore developments.
	Engineering Degree in a relevant discipline
	Experience with the development of layouts for new facilities
	Experienced in the specification, evaluation and documentation of equipment for producing oil/gas fields
	Work is performed in accordance with broad technical guidelines and with minimal supervision.
	Ability to work to tight deadlines and prioritisation of work to achieve them.
	Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.
	And there&#39;s no barrier to your potential career success.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-18",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-19",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

}



Senior Mechanical Engineer Job at WorleyParsons




        
    

        
        WorleyParsons has had a presence in Africa since the 1970's when Parsons E&C established their offices in Cairo, Egypt. Since that time the company has continued to spread across the continent and in 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Over the past five years, WorleyParsons has executed more than 100 projects in over 15 countries. In 2003 a joint venture was established in Lagos, Nigeria to form DeltaAfrik Engineering Limited. Worley Parsons has the skills and technologies to address all challenges, from small brownfield services contracts to mega greenfield projects. Our service capability covers the entire asset lifecycle: from identifying the opportunity to the operating phase.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Mechanical Engineer

Requisition ID: LAG007E
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job Field (Function / Discipline): Mechanical

Primary Objective


	Carry out development and detailed design engineering activities, including co-ordination with the various discipline groups, to engineer the next phase of minimal facility platforms (MFP’s) in the Gulf of Thailand.


Specific Accountabilities


	Perform engineering design duties associated with the development of the next phase of MFP’s, being designed by Worley.
	Duties will include equipment selection and specification, detail design in collaboration with designers and bid evaluation/ vendor document review and approval.
	Quality Assurance – Responsible for working within the provisions and guidelines of the Quality Assurance system relevant to the Oil & Gas Business Unit
	Safety – Responsible for personal safety safe working practices for the Oil & Gas Business Unit. Understand and follow OH&S procedures.


Requirements


	+10 Years of Mechanical design experience in the Oil & Gas environment, including a minimum of 2 years experience in offshore developments.
	Engineering Degree in a relevant discipline
	Experience with the development of layouts for new facilities
	Experienced in the specification, evaluation and documentation of equipment for producing oil/gas fields
	Work is performed in accordance with broad technical guidelines and with minimal supervision.
	Ability to work to tight deadlines and prioritisation of work to achieve them.
	Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.
	And there's no barrier to your potential career success.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

            
    




   


    
        Similar Jobs

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cashier",
  "description": "OCA Consulting is a specialized consultancy firm offering expert HR solutions and Project Management services tailored primarily for start-up and emerging private funds as well as institutional investors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
Job Location:&nbsp;Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role: Custodian of Trust and Precision


	As a Cashier at our luxury hotel, you are the critical guardian of our financial integrity and the final touchpoint of a guest&#39;s seamless journey.
	Far more than a processor of transactions, you are an ambassador of trust, ensuring every financial interaction is conducted with impeccable accuracy, discretion, and courtesy.
	Your role is pivotal in solidifying the guest&#39;s lasting impression, transforming a simple settlement into a moment of flawless efficiency and personalized care.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accuracy &amp; Transaction Processing:


	Handle all guest financial transactions with supreme accuracy, including check-outs, incidental charges, foreign currency exchange, and cashiering for hotel outlets (restaurants, spa, etc.).
	Operate the Property Management System (PMS), Point-of-Sale (POS) systems, and credit card terminals with expert proficiency.
	Reconcile daily transactions, ensuring all postings are accurate and properly documented.
	Balance cash drawers at the beginning and end of each shift, investigating and resolving any discrepancies immediately.
	Prepare and complete daily cashier reports, depositing drops in accordance with hotel security policies.


Guest Service &amp; Discretion:


	Process guest departures efficiently, presenting clear and accurate folios, and resolving any billing inquiries with patience, empathy, and professionalism.
	Handle sensitive financial matters with the utmost discretion and confidentiality, maintaining guest privacy at all times.
	Provide a warm, polished, and efficient farewell experience, thanking guests and inviting them to return.
	Collaborate closely with the Front Desk, Concierge, and F&amp;B teams to ensure all guest charges are captured promptly and accurately.


Compliance &amp; Security:


	Strictly adhere to all hotel financial control procedures, credit policies, and fraud prevention protocols.
	Verify the validity of all payment methods following established security guidelines.
	Maintain a secure and organized work environment, safeguarding all financial assets, documents, and equipment.


Qualifications &amp; Personal Attributes
Essential:


	B.Sc Degree in Accounting or related field or Educated to a degree level any field ( Experience is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 2 years of cash handling experience in a luxury hotel, high-end retail, or fine dining establishment.
	Impeccable numerical aptitude and a proven track record of accuracy in financial transactions.
	Exceptional attention to detail and a methodical, organized approach to work.
	High degree of personal integrity, honesty, and trustworthiness.
	Polished and professional communication skills, with the ability to explain charges clearly and courteously.
	Proficiency with hotel PMS (e.g., Opera) and POS systems, as well as standard office software.
	Ability to maintain composure and efficiency during high-volume periods.
	Flexible schedule, able to work mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays as required.


Desirable:


	Formal training in accounting, finance, or hospitality.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle guest billing concerns with diplomacy.


What We Offer


	A prestigious work environment within a world-class luxury hotel.
	Competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.
	Extensive training in luxury service standards and financial procedures.
	Complimentary meals on duty.
	Opportunities for career advancement within the finance department or broader hotel operations.


Method of Aplication&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV and Cover letter to:&nbsp;recruitment@cathelea.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "OCA Consulting"
    
  },

Cashier Job at OCA Consulting




        
    

        
        OCA Consulting is a specialized consultancy firm offering expert HR solutions and Project Management services tailored primarily for start-up and emerging private funds as well as institutional investors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
Job Location: Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role: Custodian of Trust and Precision
     

            
    




	As a Cashier at our luxury hotel, you are the critical guardian of our financial integrity and the final touchpoint of a guest's seamless journey.
	Far more than a processor of transactions, you are an ambassador of trust, ensuring every financial interaction is conducted with impeccable accuracy, discretion, and courtesy.
	Your role is pivotal in solidifying the guest's lasting impression, transforming a simple settlement into a moment of flawless efficiency and personalized care.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accuracy & Transaction Processing:


	Handle all guest financial transactions with supreme accuracy, including check-outs, incidental charges, foreign currency exchange, and cashiering for hotel outlets (restaurants, spa, etc.).
	Operate the Property Management System (PMS), Point-of-Sale (POS) systems, and credit card terminals with expert proficiency.
	Reconcile daily transactions, ensuring all postings are accurate and properly documented.
	Balance cash drawers at the beginning and end of each shift, investigating and resolving any discrepancies immediately.
	Prepare and complete daily cashier reports, depositing drops in accordance with hotel security policies.


Guest Service & Discretion:


	Process guest departures efficiently, presenting clear and accurate folios, and resolving any billing inquiries with patience, empathy, and professionalism.
	Handle sensitive financial matters with the utmost discretion and confidentiality, maintaining guest privacy at all times.
	Provide a warm, polished, and efficient farewell experience, thanking guests and inviting them to return.
	Collaborate closely with the Front Desk, Concierge, and F&B teams to ensure all guest charges are captured promptly and accurately.


Compliance & Security:


	Strictly adhere to all hotel financial control procedures, credit policies, and fraud prevention protocols.
	Verify the validity of all payment methods following established security guidelines.
	Maintain a secure and organized work environment, safeguarding all financial assets, documents, and equipment.


Qualifications & Personal Attributes
Essential:


	B.Sc Degree in Accounting or related field or Educated to a degree level any field ( Experience is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 2 years of cash handling experience in a luxury hotel, high-end retail, or fine dining establishment.
	Impeccable numerical aptitude and a proven track record of accuracy in financial transactions.
	Exceptional attention to detail and a methodical, organized approach to work.
	High degree of personal integrity, honesty, and trustworthiness.
	Polished and professional communication skills, with the ability to explain charges clearly and courteously.
	Proficiency with hotel PMS (e.g., Opera) and POS systems, as well as standard office software.
	Ability to maintain composure and efficiency during high-volume periods.
	Flexible schedule, able to work mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays as required.


Desirable:


	Formal training in accounting, finance, or hospitality.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle guest billing concerns with diplomacy.


What We Offer


	A prestigious work environment within a world-class luxury hotel.
	Competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.
	Extensive training in luxury service standards and financial procedures.
	Complimentary meals on duty.
	Opportunities for career advancement within the finance department or broader hotel operations.


Method of Aplication 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: recruitment@cathelea.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Technical Project Manager",
  "description": "Advansio Interactive is a technology-driven ideas and innovations company based in Lagos State, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Project Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(Hybrid)
Industry: Fintech / Technology Services

Role Overview


	We are seeking a highly organized and technically grounded Technical Project Manager to drive project delivery, enforce timelines, and ensure seamless coordination between engineering teams, clients, and internal stakeholders.
	This role is critical to strengthening delivery discipline, accountability, and client satisfaction across all projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, manage, and deliver technical projects end-to-end within agreed scope, timelines, and budget
	Coordinate closely with developers, QA, product, and operations teams to ensure delivery milestones are met
	Serve as the primary point of contact for clients on assigned projects, ensuring timely communication and updates
	Translate business and client requirements into clear technical tasks and project plans
	Track tasks, dependencies, risks, and progress using project management tools (e.g., ClickUp)
	Enforce QA, testing, and deployment processes before project hand-offs
	Proactively identify and resolve delivery risks, bottlenecks, and escalations
	Prepare project reports and status updates for management
	Ensure adherence to internal SOPs, SLAs, and quality standards


Requirements


	3&ndash;4 years of experience managing technical or software projects
	Strong understanding of software development lifecycles (SDLC)
	Experience working with engineering teams in fintech or technology environments
	Proficiency with project management tools (ClickUp, Jira, Trello, or similar)
	Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills
	Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
	Strong sense of ownership, structure, and accountability


Added Advantage:


	Experience in fintech, payments, or banking projects
	Technical background or exposure to APIs, integrations, or mobile/web applications
	Relevant certifications will be an advantage.


Remuneration
N300,000.00 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;hr@advansio.com&nbsp;using &quot;Technical Project Manager &ndash; Advansio&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Technical Project Manager Job at Advansio Interactive Limited




        
    

        
        Advansio Interactive is a technology-driven ideas and innovations company based in Lagos State, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Project Manager

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Industry: Fintech / Technology Services

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly organized and technically grounded Technical Project Manager to drive project delivery, enforce timelines, and ensure seamless coordination between engineering teams, clients, and internal stakeholders.
	This role is critical to strengthening delivery discipline, accountability, and client satisfaction across all projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, manage, and deliver technical projects end-to-end within agreed scope, timelines, and budget
	Coordinate closely with developers, QA, product, and operations teams to ensure delivery milestones are met
	Serve as the primary point of contact for clients on assigned projects, ensuring timely communication and updates
	Translate business and client requirements into clear technical tasks and project plans
	Track tasks, dependencies, risks, and progress using project management tools (e.g., ClickUp)
	Enforce QA, testing, and deployment processes before project hand-offs
	Proactively identify and resolve delivery risks, bottlenecks, and escalations
	Prepare project reports and status updates for management
	Ensure adherence to internal SOPs, SLAs, and quality standards


Requirements


	3–4 years of experience managing technical or software projects
	Strong understanding of software development lifecycles (SDLC)
	Experience working with engineering teams in fintech or technology environments
	Proficiency with project management tools (ClickUp, Jira, Trello, or similar)
	Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills
	Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
	Strong sense of ownership, structure, and accountability


Added Advantage:


	Experience in fintech, payments, or banking projects
	Technical background or exposure to APIs, integrations, or mobile/web applications
	Relevant certifications will be an advantage.


Remuneration
N300,000.00 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: hr@advansio.com using "Technical Project Manager – Advansio" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
